info.description: Retrieve Tasks, as surfaced in Risk Radar, which are aggregates that comprise of related Exceptions, Rules, and Workflow items.
info.title: Risk Governance - Tasks

get.description: Provides list of tasks (workflow, exceptions and rule combined) matching to search parameters provided.

parameters.description: A unique identifier for this request.
parameters.name: VND.com.blackrock.Request-ID

parameters.description: Timestamp assigned to this request at origin, in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231.
parameters.name: VND.com.blackrock.Origin-Timestamp

parameters.description:
A list of workflow states used to filter returned tasks.
If parameter value is not provided, only tasks with workflow items with non-terminal states will be returned.
If terminal states are provided and the begin range time is not provided, the workflow 
items returned for these states will be restricted to a lookback period of 45 days.
parameters.name: workflowStates

parameters.description: The workflow start date and time from which to apply the provided search parameters.
parameters.name: workflowBeginRangeTime

parameters.description: The workflow end date and time to which to apply the provided search parameters.
parameters.name: workflowEndRangeTime

400.description: Aladdin速 will not process the request due to an apparent client error.

code.description: A short mnemonic reference code for the error.

message.description: A human readable description of the error.

VND.com.blackrock.Request-ID.description: The unique identifier assigned by the client to the request that originated this response.

VND.com.blackrock.Response-ID.description: A Unique Identifier for this response.

VND.com.blackrock.Response-Timestamp.description: Timestamp assigned to this response, in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231.

401.description: Aladdin速 will not process the request as the necessary credentials were not provided or were invalid.

code.description: A short mnemonic reference code for the error.

message.description: A human readable description of the error.

VND.com.blackrock.Request-ID.description: The unique identifier assigned by the client to the request that originated this response.

VND.com.blackrock.Response-ID.description: A Unique Identifier for this response.

VND.com.blackrock.Response-Timestamp.description: Timestamp assigned to this response, in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231.

403.description: Aladdin速 understood the request but is refusing to authorize it.

code.description: A short mnemonic reference code for the error.

message.description: A human readable description of the error.

VND.com.blackrock.Request-ID.description: The unique identifier assigned by the client to the request that originated this response.

VND.com.blackrock.Response-ID.description: A Unique Identifier for this response.

VND.com.blackrock.Response-Timestamp.description: Timestamp assigned to this response, in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231.

404.description: Aladdin速 did not find the resource requested or is unwilling to disclose if it exists. Could indicate a defect in the client program or data which is no longer accessible.

code.description: A short mnemonic reference code for the error.

message.description: A human readable description of the error.

VND.com.blackrock.Request-ID.description: The unique identifier assigned by the client to the request that originated this response.

VND.com.blackrock.Response-ID.description: A Unique Identifier for this response.

VND.com.blackrock.Response-Timestamp.description: Timestamp assigned to this response, in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231.

Any.description:
`Any` contains an arbitrary serialized message along with a
URL that describes the type of the serialized message

@type.description: A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized message.

oversightgovernancev1LookThroughConfig.title: Configuration object for rule level look throughs

lookThroughPortfolio.title: Enable look through type for Portfolio

lookThroughBenchmark.title: Enable look through type for Benchmark

lookThroughProxyTypes.title: Look Through Proxy Type List, need to passed when proxy config is custom

conditionDetail.title: The additional information about the condition

limitDefinition.title:
The mandatory default limit for the condition
(-- api-linter: aladdin::0901::prefix-required-field=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this naming predates this rule --)

metricDefinition.title: The settings or additional configuration associated with the metric used within the condition

v1ConditionDetail.title:
The relevant information/definitions to be used in conjunction with
condition definitions ans results

metricUnit.title: The metric unit to be used when evaluating the condition

breakdownType.title: The type of breakdown applied with this condition, specified by the evaluator

containsBreakdown.title: Indicates whether the condition contains a breakdown

ruleOverrideId.description:
Unique identifier of the RiskRuleOverride applied to this condition.
If present, it indicates some properties of the condition have been set from a RiskRuleOverride that is in effect.

ruleOverrideVersion.title: The rule_override_version identifier for this particular revision of the rule override

metricSource.title: Metric source to be used for evaluation

v1ConditionResult.title: The condition definition for sector results related evaluations

id.title: Unique identifier, which should map to the corresponding Rule condition id if applicable

conditionDetail.title: The additional information about the condition

sectorResults.title: The sector results resulting from the evaluation of the condition

evaluationState.title: The overall evaluation state resulting from the evaluation of the condition

v1EvaluationState.description:
- EVALUATION_STATE_UNSPECIFIED: No definition present (not a valid input value)
 - EVALUATION_STATE_BREACH: High severity state signalling that the evaluation has identified a BREACH
 - EVALUATION_STATE_WARNING: Lower severity state signalling that the valuation has identified a WARNING
 - EVALUATION_STATE_OK: OK state signalling that a prior exception is no longer an exception and is to
be closed out by the system
v1EvaluationState.title: The possible outcomes from an evaluation

v1Evaluator.description:
- EVALUATOR_UNSPECIFIED: No definition present
 - EVALUATOR_ANALYTICS: Rule evaluation conducted by the Analytics evaluator
 - EVALUATOR_EXTERNAL: Rule evaluation conducted by a process that is external to the system
v1Evaluator.title: The supported set of rule evaluators

v1Limit.title: Defines the numerical thresholds associated with a Condition of a Rule

limitType.title:
Indicates how the numerical limits are being represented.
(-- api-linter: aladdin::0901::dictionary-message-field=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because lint error is for resource defined in other domain --)

target.title:
The target value for the metric bound to this limit.
This is optional if the limit type is Absolute, but required if it is Relative.
(-- api-linter: core::0203::optional=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because the required/optional behaviour is
 conditional on the limit_type property, which cannot be enforced at the schema-level --)
(-- api-linter: core::0203::required=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because the required/optional behaviour is
 conditional on the limit_type property, which cannot be enforced at the schema-level --)

thresholds.description:
Specifies the individual thresholds captured for this limit and their numerical values. 
The permitted keys are 'upperBreach', 'upperWarning', 'lowerWarning', 'lowerBreach'. 
A limit has at least one entry specified.

defaultLimit.title: The mandatory default limit for a condition definition

sectorLimits.title:
The set of sector limits, if specified, to be used in conjunction with the
default limit to provide sector-specific limit overrides

v1LimitType.description:
- LIMIT_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: No definition present
 - LIMIT_TYPE_ABSOLUTE: An absolute threshold level, e.g. 250 bps tracking error
 - LIMIT_TYPE_RELATIVE: A relative threshold level, e.g. 1.2 which is then multiplied with the target value
v1LimitType.title:
The limit type indicating whether thresholds are specified in absolute terms
or relative to the target value

v1ListRiskTasksResponse.title:
Response for the List Tasks requests
(-- api-linter: core::0158::response-next-page-token-field=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because the tasks API doesn't offer such functionality at this moment --)

workflowTaskDetails.title: A list of tasks that satisfied the request criteria

v1LookThroughProxyType.description:
- LOOK_THROUGH_PROXY_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: Look Through Proxy Unspecified
 - LOOK_THROUGH_PROXY_TYPE_PROXY: Look through type proxy
 - LOOK_THROUGH_PROXY_TYPE_RISK: Look through risk proxy
 - LOOK_THROUGH_PROXY_TYPE_PRIMARY_BENCHMARK: Look through primary benchmark proxy
 - LOOK_THROUGH_PROXY_TYPE_FUND: Look through fun proxy
v1LookThroughProxyType.title: Look through Proxy Type

v1LookThroughSecurityType.description:
- LOOK_THROUGH_SECURITY_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: Look through Security is Unspecified
 - LOOK_THROUGH_SECURITY_TYPE_FUNDS: Look through for Funds
 - LOOK_THROUGH_SECURITY_TYPE_ETF: Look through for ETF
 - LOOK_THROUGH_SECURITY_TYPE_INDEX_FUTURES: Look through for Index Futures
 - LOOK_THROUGH_SECURITY_TYPE_SYNTHETIC_INSTRUMENTS: Look through for Synthetic Instruments
 - LOOK_THROUGH_SECURITY_TYPE_CDX: Look through for CDX
 - LOOK_THROUGH_SECURITY_TYPE_BOND_FORWARD: Look through for Bond Forward
 - LOOK_THROUGH_SECURITY_TYPE_EQUITY_FORWARD: Look through for Equity Forward
 - LOOK_THROUGH_SECURITY_TYPE_EQUITY_OPTION: Look through for Equity Option
 - LOOK_THROUGH_SECURITY_TYPE_EQUITY_PRIVATE: Look through for Equity Private
v1LookThroughSecurityType.title: Look Security Type

v1MetricSource.description:
- METRIC_SOURCE_UNSPECIFIED: No definition present
 - METRIC_SOURCE_ALADDIN_ANALYTICS: Evaluator will use Aladdin Analytics as metric source
 - METRIC_SOURCE_CUSTOM: Evaluator will use CUSTOM DATA as metric source
v1MetricSource.title: Allowed metric sources

v1MetricUnit.description:
- METRIC_UNIT_UNSPECIFIED: No definition present
 - METRIC_UNIT_BPS: Basis Points
 - METRIC_UNIT_PCT: Percent
 - METRIC_UNIT_NONE: Comment placeholder
v1MetricUnit.title: The units in which the metric and its thresholds are specified

v1PortfolioAnalyticsBenchmarkConfig.title:
PortfolioAnalyticsBenchmarkConfig represents the benchmark to be used for analysis
This currently represents a benchmark type and order

benchmarkType.title: Specifies benchmark type like RISK, PERFORMANCE, FORWARD, OTHER, NONE

benchmarkOrder.title:
Specifies which benchmark should be used 
(-- api-linter: aladdin::0901::dictionary-message-field=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this is aligned with Explore UI --)

benchmarkTicker.title: Specifies benchmark ticker. This field is only needed when BenchmarkType = OTHER

v1PortfolioAnalyticsBenchmarkOrder.description:
- PORTFOLIO_ANALYTICS_BENCHMARK_ORDER_UNSPECIFIED: Unspecfied value
 - PORTFOLIO_ANALYTICS_BENCHMARK_ORDER_PRIMARY: Represents the primary order benchmark
 - PORTFOLIO_ANALYTICS_BENCHMARK_ORDER_SECONDARY: Represents the secondary order benchmark
v1PortfolioAnalyticsBenchmarkOrder.title:
BenchmarkOrder represents which benchmark should be chosen
if multiple are avaialble. Default is BENCHMARK_ORDER_PRIMARY

v1RiskException.description: Representation of Risk Exception, its available fields and the flexible one "exceptionDetail" to store more specific details.

externalId.title: The unique user-specified identifier for the exception (not used by the system)

validBeginDate.title:
The date on which the exception record is valid. Dictated by the date of the 
underlying positions used to calculate the exception. In most instances, 
the beginning date of the exceptions may precede the creation date (e.g. T-1 or T-2)

validEndDate.title:
The date at which the exception record stops being valid, e.g. it is superseded by a new 
record on the following day or because it has been closed out

entryTime.title: The timestamp when the record entered the system

expiryTime.title: The INTERNAL timestamp when the record expires

createTime.title: The timestamp when the first time-series risk entry was first created

modifier.title: Identifies the modifier of the exception

workflowId.title: The workflow Id which the exception is associated with

scopeId.title: The unique identifier of the scope of the exception. E.g. for a portfolio, this should be the portoflio code

scopeType.title: The scope of the exception e.g. one of 'GLOBAL', 'PORTFOLIO_GROUP', 'PORTFOLIO', 'OTHER'

scope.title: The name of the scope, e.g. the porfolio name

entityId.title: The unique identifier of the entity the exception refers to. E.g. for an issuer, this should be the issuer code

entityType.title:
Used to determine the type of entity the exception refers to, e.g. one of 
'PORTFOLIO_GROUP', 'PORTFOLIO', 'SECTOR', 'FACTOR', 'ISSUER', 'SECURITY', 'OTHER'

entity.title: The name of the entity that the exception is concerned with

evaluationState.title: The status set by the evaluation process. Currently supported: BREACH, WARNING and OK

rulePriority.title: The priority as provided by the rule that generated the exception and used as a common way to rank exceptions across rules

ruleId.title: The ID of the Rule that the exception is based on

ruleVersion.title: The ID of the specific version of the Rule that the exception is based on

exceptionTier.title: Visibility tier/level of the exception e.g. Prime/Prod, Beta, Testing, Local, Team etc

evaluationResults.title: The results from evaluating the Rule Conditions the exception is based on

exceptionDetails.title: Any additional details that custom exception producers may store alongside the exception to provide additional context

v1RiskRule.title: A rule definition which captures common attributes and limit definitions

evaluator.title: The evaluator indicates the type of process used for evaluation

tierKey.title: The key of the rule tier, which maps onto the Tier definition configured in the system

conditions.title: The conditions to be evaluated as part of this rule

splitExceptions.title:
This flag determines whether a rule containing a breakdown should create a joint exception or multiple 
exceptions, one for each violating sector
(-- api-linter: core::0144::message-field-plural=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because it better describes the goal of this flag.
 A rule can be applied to a set of exceptions, making it singular or giving a generic name
 instead of exceptions will maybe make the name ambiguous --)

priority.title: A priority indicator that can be used to rank Rules it's exceptions

finalSignOffAuthor.title: The user who approved the Rule

finalSignOffTime.title: The time at which the Rule was approved

modifier.title: Identifies the modifier of this rule

modifyTime.title: The time this rule was modified

version.title:
The version identifier for this particular revision of the rule
(-- api-linter: core::0124::required-reference=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because version in this context means a point in a modifications timeline --)
(-- api-linter: aladdin::0901::dictionary-message-field=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because the dictionary already contains two different versions, string and int32
 and independently of the choice, disabling the linter is necessary --)

effectiveDate.title: The date on which this particular rule version is effective from

categoryKey.title:
The key of the rule category, which maps on to the Category definition configured in the system
(-- aip.dev/beta-blocker: see if there is a way to add the type association for a filtered resource --)

versionTime.title: The internal version timestamp for Rule version

subCategoryKey.title:
The key of the rule sub-category, which maps on to the Sub-Category definition configured in the system 
(-- aip.dev/beta-blocker: see if there is a way to add the type association for a filtered resource --)

permissionScopes.title: This parameter will be used to control permissions to create/modify exceptions related to this rule

ruleSetting.title: The settings or additional configuration for the rule

v1RiskRuleState.description:
- RISK_RULE_STATE_UNSPECIFIED: No definition present
 - RISK_RULE_STATE_DRAFT: DRAFT status means that user can update the existing rule version
 - RISK_RULE_STATE_APPROVED: APPROVED status means user can't update the existing rule version 
but while editing APPROVED rule, it will generate new rule version with DRAFT state
v1RiskRuleState.title:
This is the actual rule state. 
There will be only 2 states, that is DRAFT or APPROVED both are described below

workflowActivity.title: The abstraction of an activity related to a workflow

workflowDescription.title: The description privided to give context to this item

workflowPriority.title: The priority scale for given to this task

workflowFailureMessage.title: Failure messages related to this item

workflowAvailableActions.title: The next allowd steps for this item

ruleId.title: The ID of the Rule associated with this workflow item

scopeId.title:
The unique scope identifier of the exception associated to this workflow item. E.g. for a portfolio, this should be the portfolio code
(-- api-linter: core::0124::required-reference=disabled
    aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this is an existing attribute in risk_exception.proto and has to be same --)

scopeType.title: The scope type of the exception associated with this workflow item e.g. one of 'GLOBAL', 'PORTFOLIO_GROUP', 'PORTFOLIO', 'OTHER'

workflowAssignee.title: The user to who a workflow item (task) is assigned to

workflowComment.title: A comment placed by a user

workflowAction.title: The action taken on this item

workflowState.title: The state of this particular item, e.g. In Review

workflowResolutionCategoryKey.title:
The key of the workflow resolution category, which maps onto the Resolution Category definition configured in the system
(-- aip.dev/beta-blocker: see if there is a way to add the type association for a filtered resource --)

workflowResolutionKey.title:
The key of the workflow resolution, which maps onto the Resolution definition configured in the system
(-- aip.dev/beta-blocker: see if there is a way to add the type association for a filtered resource --)

modifier.title: Identifies the modifier that performed the activity

modifyTime.title: The time the workflow activity was performed

createTime.title: The time the underlying workflow item was created

dueDate.title:
The date by which the current workflow state should be actioned
(-- api-linter: core::0142::time-field-type=disabled aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because due date is the more natural term the business would use to describe this--)
(-- api-linter: core::0142::time-field-names=disabled aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because due date is the more natural term the business would use to describe this --)

workflowPriority.title: The relative priority given to this task

v1RiskWorkflowPriority.description:
- RISK_WORKFLOW_PRIORITY_UNSPECIFIED: No definition present
 - RISK_WORKFLOW_PRIORITY_HIGH: The item has been identified as a high priority actionable task
 - RISK_WORKFLOW_PRIORITY_MEDIUM: The item has been identified as a medium priority actionable task
 - RISK_WORKFLOW_PRIORITY_LOW: The item has been identified as a low priority actionable task
v1RiskWorkflowPriority.title: Priority scale for Risk Governance Workflow Items

v1SectorResult.title:
It represents the evaluation results
for specific category values for the selected breakdown

lastThresholdCrossed.title: The most severe predefined threshold crossed when performing an evaluation

evaluationState.title: The evaluated state of the sector result indicating the exception severity (or OK)

actualValue.title: The actual value of the underlying metric being validated against the Rule Condition limits

limit.title: The numerical thresholds associated with the corresponding Rule Condition

v1Threshold.description:
- THRESHOLD_UNSPECIFIED: No definition present
 - THRESHOLD_UPPER_BREACH: An evaluation has identified a scenario which the values are beyond any pre-defined limit
 - THRESHOLD_LOWER_BREACH: An evaluation has identified a scenario which the values are somewhere
in betewen OK and UPPER_BREACH
 - THRESHOLD_UPPER_WARNING: An evaluation has identified a scenario where the values are close 
but not yet to be considered a breach
 - THRESHOLD_LOWER_WARNING: An evaluation has identified a scenario where the values are on
the way to be considered a breach
v1Threshold.title:
The available threshold levels to be used in order to better identify
the most severe problems

v1WorkflowTaskDetail.title: A representation of a workflow task details data structure

riskWorkflow.title: The workflow item representing a actionable task

riskException.title: The exception related to the given task

riskRule.title: The rule related to the given task

OAuth2AccessCode.description: This API uses OAuth 2.0 with the access code flow.

scopes.offline_access: This keeps you signed in to the app, even when you are not using it.

OAuth2ClientCredentials.description: This API uses OAuth 2.0 with the client credentials flow.

scopes.offline_access: This keeps you signed in to the app, even when you are not using it.
